text: after largely standing on the sidelines
turkeys now joined the fight against the
Islamic extremists for the first time
its warplanes have hit the group also
known as - in neighboring Syria but it's
also been targeting an old enemy the
Kurdish separatist group the PKK the
complication is the PKK has been helping
in the fight against - and while most
see a difference Turkey does not today
special meeting at NATO headquarters has
been called by turkey under the rarely
used article for when a member state
feels its own Security's threatened
turkeys not looking for military but
political support from NATO its allies
will be trying to work out Turkey's
motivation and goals
Turkey's attacks on the PKK could muddy
the waters they've already been violent
demonstrations in Turkey in targeting
the PKK allied to Iraqi and Syrian Kurds
there is a fear it could undermine the
fight against - NATO though is likely to
be broadly supportive not least because
America's welcomed its intervention and
for the first time is being allowed to
fly missions against the extremists from
a Turkish airbase the US and Turkey are
also working on plans to create a buffer
zone free of Islamic state fighters in
northern Syria a sign that turkey is now
more willing to help in the fight
